metadata.Title: CVE-2023-32233 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel through 6.3.1, a use-after-free in Netfilter nf_tables when processing batch requests can be abused to perform arbitrary read and write operations on kernel memory. Unprivileged local users can obtain root privileges. This occurs because anonymous sets are mishandled. Patryk Sondej and Piotr Krysiuk discovered that a race condition existed in the netfilter subsystem of the Linux kernel when processing batch requests, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1119-aws - 4.4.0-1119.125
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1166-azure - 4.15.0-1166.181~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-lowlatency - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1166-azure - 4.15.0-1166.181~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-lowlatency - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: cascardo> requires CAP_NET_ADMIN, however this can be done within a new user namespace and network namespace - so can be mitigated by disabling unprivileged user namespaces.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1119.125').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1166.181~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1').
linux-signed package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1166.181~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1').
